socialSecurityDeathIndex

Class DatabaseConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialSecurityDeathIndex.DatabaseConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDatabaseConnection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BeanDatabaseConnection, MySqlDatabaseConnection, SqlServerDatabaseConnection

    public abstract class DatabaseConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDatabaseConnection
    A default implementation of the IDatabaseConnection interface.
    Subclasses inherit from DatabaseConnection to establish a connection to a database from a specific vendor (sponsor).
    These subclasses must implement at least the ConnectToDatabase method.

      • ConnectToDatabase

        public abstract void ConnectToDatabase(int iPort)
                                throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                       java.sql.SQLException
        Execute a database-specific connection
        Parameters:
        iPort - TCP port to connect to
        Throws:
        java.lang.InstantiationException - if the driver class for the chosen database sponsor cannot be loaded
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the driver class or its nullary constructor is not accessible
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the driver class for the chosen database sponsor cannot be found
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while connecting to the database
